Configuration Scenarios

Configuring Externals

The Externals feature enables you to add your own configuration data that is not related to Nagios but can be useful when integrating other tools. When externals are enabled, you can add this data to host and service profiles, which can then be applied to instantiated host and service definitions.

You can then execute the Build Externals command, which will call a user written program in MonarchExternals.pm. The user program can process the externals data associated with the host and service definitions in monarch. For example, the externals data can be used to generate a configuration update for another monitoring tool based on monarch changes. This is an advanced feature that requires some knowledge of Perl to modify MonarchExternals.pm.

Enable Externals

Show/Hide To enable externals within GroundWork Monitor, select Control from the Configuration tab, then Setup and click the Enable Externals box, and Save. You are then able to define, add, and execute externals using the Services, Profiles, and Hosts configuration tabs.

Figure: Enable Externals

Search Externals

Show/Hide Additionally, you have the ability to search for service and host externals. When externals are enabled the Search Service Externals and the Search Host Externals options will be available under Services and Hosts.

Figure: Search Externals

Creating Externals

Show/Hide

Figure: Creating Externals

  1. To create a host or service external, select Hosts or Services from the Configuration page.

  2. Select Host Externals (or Service Externals).

  3. Select New.

  4. Enter a Name, and Details for the external.

  5. Select Add and Continue, you will then see the new external listed under Modify.

Adding Externals

Show/Hide

Figure: Adding Externals

  1. You can then add service or host externals within the Services, Profiles, and Host configuration options.

  2. To execute the externals select Control from the Configuration page, and Build Externals, which will execute your code in MonarchExternals.pm.
